name: Interlox
overview: Interlox is a computer board game based upon Noughts & Crosses/Tic-Tac-Toe. Played on four interlocking squares simultaneously, the goal is to place pieces on a board to align 3-in-a-row either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally, while preventing the opponent from doing the same. Pieces are placed by pressing the button corresponding to the board position. In a 2-player game, the player with the most runs of 3 after all positions are filled is the winner. Versus the computer, the goal is to prevent them from getting a run of 3 while trying to maximize player runs of 3.
